title: Adriano (footballer, born February 1982)
summary: Adriano Leite Ribeiro (born February 17, 1982), commonly known simply as Adriano "Emperor", is a  Brazilian former professional footballer. A striker known for his long range left footed strikes, Adriano's career was however marked by inconsistency.[1] One of the best strikers in the world in the mid 2000s, he had five prolific seasons in Italy with Parma and Inter Milan, earning the nickname L'Imperatore (the Emperor), before a decline in his performances which coincided with the death of his father.[2][3] Adriano won four Scudetti for Inter Milan, and after moving back to his native Brazil he won two Brasileir√£o for Flamengo and Corinthians.
